  "description": "Pharmacy Plus Limited, a Pharmaceutical company in Lagos, is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a proactive and reliable Key Account Executive to oversee sales and payment collections from key customers within the Idumota market and surrounding areas in Lagos.
	This role requires someone with in-depth knowledge of the terrain, excellent communication skills, and a strong sense of accountability.


Job&nbsp;Description


	Manage and grow relationships with existing key accounts-distributors, sub-distributors, and wholesale buyers.
	Drive product sales, stock availability, and brand visibility across your assigned territory.
	Ensure timely collection of payments and maintain clean account records in line with company credit policies.
	Monitor market trends, customer needs, and competitor activities to inform sales strategy.
	Conduct regular field visits to build rapport, address issues, and follow up on pending invoices.
	Provide daily/weekly reports on sales performance, collections, and outstanding accounts.
	Collaborate with internal teams to resolve customer disputes or account discrepancies.


Job&nbsp;Requirements


	HND / B.Sc Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Biological Sciences, or a related field.
	1-2 years of experience in pharmaceutical sales or key account management, especially in open drug markets.
	Strong familiarity with the Idumota market and its business dynamics is essential.
	Proven ability to drive collections and maintain healthy customer relationships.
	Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet targets.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hrpp.recruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

title: Job Openings at Eric Kayser Nigeria
content:
Eric Kayser Nigeria is part of the globally renowned Maison Kayser brand, founded by master baker Eric Kayser in Paris, France. Established in Nigeria to bring authentic French bakery excellence to the local market, Eric Kayser Nigeria is known for its commitment to artisanal craftsmanship, high-quality ingredients, and exceptional customer experience. With locations in key parts of Lagos—including Victoria Island, Ikoyi, and the Murtala Muhammed Airport—Eric Kayser Nigeria offers a wide range of freshly baked breads, viennoiseries, pastries, and gourmet meals, all made with the finest techniques and natural sourdough.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



At the heart of Eric Kayser Nigeria is a dedication to excellence, innovation, and hospitality, making it a preferred destination for both everyday indulgence and premium café experiences. We are proud to uphold the global Kayser tradition while infusing it with local relevance and exceptional service tailored to the Nigerian market.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Housekeeper

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Admin Manager

Job Summary


	The Housekeeper will be responsible for maintaining a clean, organized, and comfortable living environment for expatriate residents. This role requires strong housekeeping skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to ensuring high living standards.
	The ideal candidate will also possess the ability to prepare simple Lebanese and Middle Eastern meals, which will be considered an added advantage.


Key Responsibilities
Housekeeping & Cleaning Duties:


	Ensure all assigned rooms, living areas, and bathrooms are cleaned daily and maintained to high hygiene standards.
	Perform dusting, vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, and sanitizing of all areas, including furniture, appliances, and fixtures.
	Change bed linens, wash and iron clothes, and ensure all wardrobe and storage areas are neatly arranged.
	Maintain cleanliness in kitchens, ensuring all utensils and appliances are cleaned and properly stored after use.
	Handle laundry duties, including washing, ironing, folding, and organizing clothing and household fabrics.
	Monitor and report any maintenance issues, damages, or necessary repairs to the Facility Manager promptly.
	Maintain an inventory of cleaning supplies and request replenishments as needed.
	Prepare basic Lebanese and Mediterranean dishes such as hummus, tabbouleh, fattoush, shawarma, grilled meats, and other light home-style meals as required.
	Plan and prepare simple, healthy meals according to residents’ preferences.
	Ensure kitchen hygiene, food safety, and proper storage of ingredients and perishables.
	Assist with grocery shopping and restocking household essentials as requested.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE or equivalent; additional vocational training in hospitality or housekeeping is an advantage with 2-5 years experience..
	Proven experience as a housekeeper, domestic staff, or steward — preferably in expatriate homes, hotels, or serviced apartments.
	Ability to cook and serve Lebanese or Mediterranean-style dishes (highly desirable).
	Excellent knowledge of cleaning materials, tools, and modern housekeeping techniques.
	Strong attention to detail, reliability, and integrity.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and maintain confidentiality.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be physically fit and able to manage repetitive tasks.


Preferred Attributes:


	Polite, respectful, and well-organized.
	Willing to learn and adapt to household routines and expectations.
	A positive and professional attitude toward work and team members.
	Flexible and available to work during weekends or evenings when required.


Compensation & Benefits


	N100,000 / Month (Based on experience).
	Accommodation may be provided.
	Meals and work uniforms (if applicable).
	Opportunity to learn new culinary and housekeeping skills.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Cashier

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a reliable and customer-focused Cashier to join our restaurant team.
	The ideal candidate will handle all cash transactions accurately, provide excellent customer service, and maintain a friendly and professional attitude at all times.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle customer payments (cash, POS, transfers) efficiently and accurately
	Issue receipts and maintain proper transaction records
	Reconcile daily sales and prepare reports
	Ensure the cash register area is neat and organized
	Assist customers with inquiries and ensure a pleasant dining experience
	Work closely with other team members to ensure smooth restaurant operations.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO / OND qualification
	Proven experience as a cashier or in a similar customer service role (restaurant experience is an advantage)
	Strong numerical and communication skills
	Honest, trustworthy, and detail-oriented
	Must be punctual, courteous, and well-presented.


Salary
N90,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 17th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Display Attendant

Job Location: Victoria Island / Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and creative Display Attendant to manage and maintain product displays across our retail space.
	The ideal candidate will ensure that merchandise is presented in a visually appealing, organized, and customer-friendly manner in line with company standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Set up, organize, and maintain product displays based on seasonal themes, promotional events, and visual merchandising guidelines.
	Ensure all displays are clean, fully stocked, properly labeled, and in good condition.
	Collaborate with the sales and inventory teams to ensure products on display are available and accurately represented.
	Monitor display effectiveness and suggest improvements to increase customer engagement.
	Replace damaged or outdated signage and display materials as needed.
	Ensure safety and accessibility of all display setups.
	Support general store operations when required.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND qualification with 2 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Good sense of visual composition and design.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Previous experience in visual merchandising or retail is an advantage.
	Flexibility to work weekends, holidays, and varied shifts as needed.


Salary
N80,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 17th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
